documents.title: view from the gantrysunderland v west brom ( 15:00 bst )
text: `` there have n't been many mentions of sunderland amidst this week 's sorry england tale .
there should have been .
`` we 'll never know , but if sam allardyce had stayed they might not have been in their latest sorry state .
as for what else might not have happened

`` staying with fantastical thoughts , it 's possible that david moyes ' managerial career might not have happened in the same way had tony pulis ' gillingham not won at preston in january 1998 , prompting gary peters to resign and make way for a 34-year-old moyes to take over at deepdale .
`` some 'what ifs ' that bring the film sliding doors to mind .
it makes a change from sunderland 's usual - groundhog day . ''

documents.title: prosecutor jailed for stabbing wife
text: a lawyer who worked for the crown prosecution service in the west midlands has been jailed for six years after admitting attempting to murder his wife while depressed .

iain farrimond , 54 , of of battenhall road in worcester , failed to kill his wife tina of 28 years with a large kitchen knife , and then beat her with a wooden ornamental cat - only stopping the assault when she pleaded with him .
judge gregory dickinson , in sentencing `` loving and devoted husband '' farrimond at .
at nottingham crown court , described it as a sad case , committed while the attacker was `` in the grip of severe depressive illness '' .

documents.title: your questions : why so many roadworks into birmingham ?
text: for drivers commuting in and out of birmingham during rush hour it can feel like there are always roadworks .
car-clogged roads are made even worse for drivers with regular diversions and temporary traffic lights .
but why are there so many roadworks on the m6 and a38 ?
barbara adams from coleshill , warwickshire asked about this using your questions .
here we explain the background .
ask us what you 've always wondered about where you live and your question could be making the news .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: lawyer stabbed wife in the head when he was depressed
text: a court has heard how a senior court prosecutor with the crown prosecution service ( cps ) in birmingham stabbed his wife in the head as she slept after a bout of depression brought on by the pressures of work .

nottingham crown court heard that iain farrimond , 54 , told police immediately afterwards that he had intended his assault in the early hours of 26 may , the day before his wedding anniversary , to be the `` day of death '' .
farrimond , of battenhall road in worcester , who had penned a suicide note at the scene of the assault , admitted attempted murder .
the court was told that his wife , who suffered five stab wounds in the attack , had enjoyed a `` remarkably successful '' recovery from her physical injuries .
farrimond , who was dismissed from the cps following the incident , will be sentenced later .

documents.title: motorcyclist killed in crash named by police
text: a motorcyclist who died in a crash near oswestry has been officially identified .
scott roberts , who was 32 and from great wyrley , near walsall lost his life when his bike collided with a car near the mile end roundabout , on monday morning .

documents.title: katharine merry says time is right in race for 2026 commonwealth games
text: the former olympic sprinter katharine merry says it is `` about time '' birmingham and the west midlands hosted a multi-sport event as it bids to host the 2026 commonwealth games .
she said : `` we 've been accused of dropping behind sheffield and manchester in terms of our sporting prowess , which i would challenge because of the amount of international competitions we have .

`` this is exciting , we really really are ready for it , the infrastructure we have in place across birmingham and the west midlands is second to none , we 're 30m ahead of the rest of the field already . ''

documents.title: lawyer pleads guilty to attempted murder
text: a lawyer has pleaded guilty to attempted murder .

documents.title: bob marley musical comes to the stage
text: a stage musical based on the life and music of bob marley is coming , and will have its premiere in birmingham in march .
one love : the bob marley musical will feature the reggae legend 's classic tracks like no woman no cry , exodus and jamming .
it has the blessing of his family , including daughter cadella , who said birmingham was a `` natural place for its uk premiere '' , adding :

with its great mix of cultures , it 's a city where my father performed to audiences that were captivated by his presence , and we have no doubt that telling the story through music to a new generation in birmingham will be part of his continuing legacy .
the show will be written and directed by kwame kwei-armah and is an updated version of his show marley , which he staged in baltimore last year .
the new show will open at the birmingham repertory theatre on 10 march and run to 8 april .

documents.title: large kitchen knife wielded during armed robbery
text: a robber has targeted a convenience store in the black country wielding a large kitchen knife , west midlands police says .
masked men entered a one stop branch on swan lane , wordsley , just before 22:00 last night .
an armed offender demanded cash and vodka as an accomplice kept watch at the door .
they made off on foot with £ 80 and two bottles of alcohol .
two men , aged 22 , have been arrested .

mr lloyd was a third-year environmental management student at bangor university .
emergency services were called at 14:50 bst on tuesday to a river at aberglaslyn , near beddgelert .
his body was recovered following a `` complex operation '' involving mountain rescue and underwater search teams .

documents.title: john lewis boss chosen as conservative mayor candidate
text: john lewis boss andy street will leave the department store chain after being chosen to run as the conservative candidate for west midlands mayor .
mr street , who calls himself a `` proud brummie '' , was formally selected by local party members to fight the election in may next year .
he has handed in his resignation at john lewis and will leave within a month , a member of his team said .

labour 's candidate is siôn simon , an mep for the west midlands , while beverley neilsen , a former chief executive of the heart of england tourist board , has been chosen as the liberal democrats ' candidate .

documents.title: former olympic sprinter katharine merry speaks of wider benefits of commonwealth games bid
text: former olympic bronze medalist katharine merry has said if birmingham were successful in winning its bid for the 2026 commonwealth games it could have wider benefits for the west midlands .

the former birchfield harrier said : `` there 's so many reasons , the amount of visitors that could come , the amount of money that could come into the city and the surrounding areas , the amount of jobs it can create , there 's so many positive things - now is our time .
`` for glasgow it generated nearly £ 400m , scotland as a whole , knocking on nearly £ 800m .
`` the emphasis is n't just on birmingham , its the surrounding areas too , for example we could use the ricoh arena in coventry . ''

documents.title: kenichi phillips : teen shot for 'straying on rival drug dealer 's turf '
text: an 18-year-old was shot in the throat and killed because he strayed onto a rival drug dealer 's turf , a court heard .
kenichi phillips , 18 , was targeted as he sat in a parked car in birmingham on 17 march .
his brother kwamae phillips , who was driving , and passenger khaleel johnson , narrowly missed being injured by a second shot , the jury heard .
disharn downie , 18 , and dean silvera , 37 , are on trial charged with murder .
they both deny that charge as well as others of attempted murder and possession of a firearm with intent to endanger life .
the trial continues .

documents.title: ex-aston villa caretaker boss named in corruption claims
text: southampton assistant manager eric black gave undercover reporters advice on how to bribe officials at other clubs , the daily telegraph has claimed .
black , 52 , was filmed apparently naming staff at other clubs who could be induced to pass on information about players to a company for money .
such payments would be against football association rules .
black , who oversaw aston villa 's final seven premier league matches last season , has denied the allegations .

documents.title: birmingham to bid to host 2026 commonwealth games
text: birmingham is joining the bidding to host the 2026 commonwealth games .
city council leader john clancy said birmingham was a `` fantastic sporting city '' , hosting major events including the ashes and the rugby world cup .
the council has launched a feasibility study and claimed the event could generate more than £ 390m for the region .
it is 31 years since the city attempted to host the summer olym of 1992 , but those behind the commonwealth bid say the city is ready to play host this time .

documents.title: pc amar hussain has extra years added to his jail term for false terror kidnap claim
text: a policeman who claimed terrorists were going to kidnap a fellow officer has had an extra two years tagged on to his `` unduly lenient '' previous jail term of seven years .
amar tasaddiq hussain , 29 , made a hoax 999 call in which he claimed an officer with the west midlands force would be abducted by a radical muslim with links to the so-called islamic state .

in may , hussain was jailed for seven years and adil bashir , 26 , and 31-year-old muhammed ali sheikh , were convicted of the same charges of conspiring to pervert the course of justice and were originally each sentenced to three years in prison .

attorney general jeremy wright qc mp referred these sentences to the court of appeal under the unduly lenient sentence scheme , as he believed the original sentences should be replaced with longer terms .
the court has today increased the sentence of hussain to nine years ' imprisonment and the sentences of both bashir and sheikh to five years in jail , the attorney general said .

documents.title: cameroon asylum row man 'told to prove he is gay '
text: an asylum seeker says he `` lived in fear '' and had to hide who he was when he lived in cameroon .
valerie ediage has had an asylum application turned down and says , as a gay man , his life would be at risk if he returned to the african nation .
homosexuals in the country can be jailed for up to five years .
the 30-year-old said he moved to the uk to escape persecution over his sexuality and now lives in west bromwich with his partner , who is also from cameroon but has been granted uk residency .
the home office has declined to comment specifically on the case but said asylum applicants needed to show they faced persecution .
mr ediage volunteers at a support group for gay people in coventry and says he has supplied evidence including intimate photographs with his partner and support letters from gay friends .
he said : `` '' they [ the home office ] say i have n't given them sufficient evidence but i have given them everything . ''

documents.title: jlr crash victim will be `` missed every minute of every day ''
text: a motorcyclist who died in a crash on the lode lane jaguar land rover factory site in solihull on monday has been named as kieren rowe .
the 23-year-old , who died at the scene , was described by his parents as a `` loving , caring , witty lad , with an amazing personality and huge heart '' .
they said `` we are devastated `` that `` our beautiful boy was tragically taken away from us '' and `` he will be missed every minute of every day '' .
a statement from jlr said it was working `` closely with the authorities '' to look at how the crash , on monday afternoon , occurred .
mr rowe was an employee of a supplier to the site .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ryder cup 2016 : danny willett apologises for brother 's 'us fans imbeciles ' rant
text: europe 's danny willett has said sorry for an article written by his brother in which he called american ryder cup fans a `` baying mob of imbeciles '' .
solihull schoolteacher peter willett wrote the piece for a golf magazine , offering his thoughts on what each side needed to do to win the biennial event at hazeltine .
`` the americans need their baying mob of imbeciles to caress their egos every step of the way , '' he wrote .
danny willett said : `` i apologise .
it 's not the thoughts of me or the team . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: men deny giving cash to brussels bomb suspect 'the man in the hat '
text: two men from birmingham have denied giving money to brussels bomb suspect mohamed abrini .

mohammed ali ahmed , 27 , and zakaria boufassil , 26 , allegedly met abrini - referred to by belgian police as `` the man in the hat '' - and handed over £ 3,000 at small heath park , birmingham , in july last year .
the pair appeared at the old bailey with a third defendant from birmingham , soumaya boufassil , 30 .
she is accused , along with ahmed , of researching and planning `` secure methods by which to travel undetected overseas '' .
all denied preparation of terrorist acts .
the defendants are due to stand trial on 14 november .

documents.title: jaguar 'wo n't be moving production outside uk ' post-brexit
text: jaguar land rover 's motto when it comes to brexit is `` keep calm and carry on '' , says sales chief andy goss .
the firm exports 80 % of its cars , so a weaker pound could help .
it has car plants all over the world - but `` would n't be moving production outside of britain '' .
`` we build cars in brazil , china , india , and we 're going to build cars in slovakia and frankly we will not be put off our stride by this [ brexit vote ] .
our plants in the uk are effectively working five days a week , 24 hours a day , and we 're going to continue that success story , without a doubt . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: former england boss big sam pulls out of event to unveil blue plaque in his home town
text: ex-england boss sam allardyce will no longer be making an appearance in his home town of dudley to unveil a blue plaque to commemorate footballer duncan edwards .
sir bobby charlton - who survived the air disaster that killed 21-year-old edwards - will attend on saturday instead .
edwards , who lived on dudley 's priory estate , died along with other manchester united team members in 1958 when the aeroplane that was carrying them from a match crashed in munich .
allardyce stood down as england boss after just 67 days when a story in the daily telegraph said he was seeking to monetise his position and had spoken with indiscretion about his predecessor .

documents.title: teens bailed over facebook assault
text: two teenagers arrested by police investigating an assault on a girl that was filmed and published on facebook have been released on bail .
a 13-year-old girl was left needing hospital treatment after the attack in amington , tamworth on monday .
a 15-year-old girl and a 13-year-old boy were questioned by officers yesterday .

documents.title: alton towers starts to see recovery in trade
text: trade has started to recover at alton towers following a crash on its smiler rollercoaster last year .
its owners , merlin entertainments , said visitor numbers had up over summer , but that overall numbers `` still remain some way below the 2014 level '' .
on tuesday , the company was fined £ 5m for the incident , for which it has apologised .
sixteen people were injured in june 2015 , including including two teenage girls who needed leg amputations .
chanda chauhan , from wednesbury , was among the victims .
she had surgery to her stomach and treatment for a damaged liver and blood clots .

documents.title: body cameras for all west midlands police officers
text: body cameras are going to be given to all west midlands police response officers by the end of next month .
it comes as a new study suggests it leads to a drop in complaints made against forces .
det chief supt chris todd says the west midlands was part of research led by cambridge university , which encouraged them to make this decision .
the year-long study found the use of body-worn cameras sees complaints against police `` virtually vanish '' and involved 2,000 officers across uk and us forces .

the findings suggested the introduction of wearable cameras led to a 93 % drop in complaints made against police by the public - suggesting , the report said , that cameras resulted in behavioural changes that `` cool down '' potentially volatile encounters .
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

documents.title: thousands of seasonal jobs created in rugeley
text: about 4,500 seasonal jobs are set to be created at amazon 's rugeley depot to help the online retailer meet demand over the christmas period .
sara williams , the chief executive of the staffordshire chamber of commerce , said despite only being seasonal jobs it was `` fantastic '' news at an expensive time of year .
she said it was also a valuable chance for people who have unemployed for some time to get used to the workplace again .
author: Emma Thomas
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: jaguar wants 'tariff-free ' eu access
text: jaguar land rover has given a strong warning on brexit , saying tariffs in europe could mean job losses here - and europe is the car maker 's biggest market .
at the paris motor show , andy goss , jlr 's global sales operations director , said : `` europe is extremely important .
europe 's about a fifth of our sales .
it 's a critical market for jlr .
we 'd like to have a tariff-free environment so we can continue to sell .
we 'd actually like to also attract the best labour on an ongoing basis . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: new land rover discovery launched in the west midlands
text: twenty-seven years after the model was first launched , solihull-based land rover revealed the latest discovery last night .
the latest version of the 4x4 had its global debut here in the west midlands .
but the centrepiece was a guinness world record-breaking lego replica of tower bridge made out of 5.8m pieces - enough to carry the weight of two of the vehicles .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: alexandra hospital meeting : former consultant hits out
text: a former consultant at the alexandra hospital in redditch , dr santi vathenen , returned from west sussex to hit out at his former bosses .
hundreds of protestors took part in a rally and public meeting in redditch last night about the running of worcestershire 's hospitals .
at the meeting , dr vathenen attacked the way services are being moved away from the alexandra .
making [ the alexandra hospital ] work as a part-time , run-down hospital with some services missing is not an option .
you ca n't have acute medicine at the alexandra hospital without surgery , without gynaecology , without these services . ''
chris tidman , the interim chief executive of the trust which runs the alex and the worcestershire royal , says moving services will not put patients ' lives in danger .

we had [ these kind of concerns ] 12 or 13 years ago at kidderminster , there were lots of concerns about what will happen with a 30 minute drive to worcester , but all the evidence shows once you dial 999 an ambulance you up and you are in good hands . ''
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: velo birmingham event sees problems with priority bookings
text: cyclists hoping to sign up for a 100-mile event around birmingham have been airing their frustration after the priority bookings website suffered problems .
would-be participants were set to register from 08:00 today but have been left disappointed .
organisers took to twitter to explain it was a `` technical issue due to demand '' .
for others the explanations is not good enough either .
the event , which is expected to involve 15,000 riders , is due to take place on 24 september 2017 .

text: a meeting is being held in redditch later where campaigners are due to question health service managers over downgraded health services .
managers at the town 's alexandra hospital say they withdrew children 's inpatient services amid a shortage of junior doctors .
a meeting is being held at redditch town hall where campaigners - including members of the save the alex group - will put questions to health service managers .

documents.title: multimillion-pound windfall for birmingham from edgbaston hosting 2017 tournament
text: a £ 25.3m windfall will come to birmingham 's economy as edgbaston cricket ground hosts five of the fixtures during the .
icc champions trophy 2017 , a new study says .

marketing birmingham regional observatory has carried out the research on the impact of warwickshire 's home ground hosting four matches in the group stages and one of the semi-finals of the competition between the top eight-ranked international sides .
neil snowball , chief executive of edgbaston stadium , said : `` we expect all five games to be sell-outs and attract more than 120,000 spectators to birmingham across the tournament . ''
the fixtures edgbaston will host during the competition running from 1-18 june include england v australia , india v pakistan , australia v new zealand and pakistan v south africa .

text: the queen elizabeth hospital in birmingham is under `` significant '' pressure due to downgraded health services in worcestershire , a trust boss says .
neonatal and children 's inpatient services have moved from the alexandra hospital in redditch to the worcestershire royal and some accident and emergency services have also been transferred .

university hospitals birmingham chief executive dame julie moore has said they are being directly affected by the changes - with an increase in demand for the emergency department at the qe and more patients choosing to receive their care there too .
hospital bosses in worcestershire refute the claims .

documents.title: arrest over filmed assault on teenage girl
text: a 15-year-old girl has been arrested in connection with the assault of a girl in amington , tamworth .
the 13-year-old victim , who police say was treated in hospital for minor injuries , was injured on monday .
staffordshire police has said `` distressing '' footage of the attack is in circulation on social media and should not be shared .

documents.title: heroin smuggler jailed four years after going on the run
text: a fugitive who spent four years on the run in connection with a £ 1 million drug smuggling operation was arrested trying to hide under a roof .
tahir mahmood was jailed for seven years at birmingham crown court on tuesday after admitting conspiracy to import heroin from iran in 2012 , according to the national crime agency ( nca ) .
the agency said mahmood , of kenelm road in small heath , fled following his original arrest but officers caught up with him on 1 august this year .
the nca said the 37-year-old mahmood `` was attempting to climb into the roof space of an out-building at his family 's home '' when he was caught .
the drugs haul was discovered hidden in handbags during a search of cargo at heathrow airport by border force officers .
nca investigators said mahmood had helped `` orchestrate '' the smuggling operation and linked him to the haul through phone analysis .

documents.title: owners find body of their headless cat
text: a cat 's headless body has been found in its owner 's garden .
luna , a one-year-old black and white cat , had been dead for a month before her body was found on sunday , a vet said .
her owners say her body had not been there they were out in the garden two hours earlier .
owner penny price from pelsall , walsall , said she 's been left `` devastated . ''
rspca officer rob crutchley said he could not say how the cat got her injuries or if her head was lost after she died .
`` it is possible her head may have been removed by wildlife .
however , we are not ruling anything out so we urge anyone who has any information to contact us , '' he said .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : andy burnham mp calls for 'level playing field ' on legal fees
text: andy burnham , the mp who backed the hillsborough families in their fight for new inquests , is now calling for equal legal funding for families of those who died in the birmingham pub bombings .
the government has said it will not pay for their legal fees for new inquests into the deaths of 21 people in 1974 directly , but it has supported an application for legal aid .
mr burnham said relatives are entitled to a level legal playing field
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

documents.title: former mp takes waste case to united nations
text: a former birmingham mp who tried to force the city council to clear garden waste dumped by fly tippers has taken his case to the united nations .
john hemming - who used to be the liberal democrat mp for yardley - argued local authorities had a duty to keep streets clean , but judges ruled against him .
he says he 's been left with a £ 30,000 legal bill and he 's asked a united nations committee to look at issues raised to see if local authorities should be taken to task .

documents.title: fewer drivers on mobile phones 'caught by police '
text: the number of drivers caught using a mobile phone behind the wheel has almost halved in five years , the bbc can reveal .
some 178,000 people were stopped in 2011-12 by police in the uk , compared with under 95,000 last year .
the west midlands has seen a drop of nearly 60 % in that time .
the national police federation said the drop was due to fewer traffic officers .
but police say tougher new sentences will help discourage drivers using their phones .

documents.title: slavery probe finds 'malnourished ' men working for £ 1 per hour
text: west midlands police is urging people to look out for tell-tale signs of modern slavery after the arrest of three men yesterday .

officers searching plants in west bromwich and oldbury came across six polish men they suspected were being employed as slave labourers , one of whom is alleged to have been working despite having a broken shoulder .
some of the others `` displayed signs of malnutrition , '' a police spokesman said .
the force says it found polish nationals working for what it suspected could have been as little as £ 1 an hour , while others were allegedly sleeping on cardboard .
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

documents.title: your questions : why birmingham 's water comes from wales
text: every day 320 million litres of water travels 73 miles ( 117 km ) from wales to birmingham to fill kettles , baths and boilers .
but why does it come so far ?
it dates back to the victorian era when birmingham was a rapidly growing city but plagued by illnesses like cholera and typhoid , caused by contaminated water .
a search for clean water sparked an `` amazing feat of ingenuity '' to bring it from the welsh hills to the city .
and a century on repair work is preserving the supply for the next 100 years .
paul james got in touch to ask about this report through your questions .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: birmingham street preacher guilty of abusing woman over 'tight jeans ' is sentenced
text: a street preacher who told a muslim woman in birmingham that she 'd 'burn in hell ' for wearing tight jeans has been sentenced at birmingham magistrates ' court .
krisonni henderson , 31 , of brook street , birmingham has been sentenced to a 24-month community order with a curfew and ordered to complete an anger management course .
speaking in court immediately after sentencing , henderson , who the court was told suffered with bipolar disorder , said : `` i am completely innocent . ''
the married father of one added : `` i am going to turn my life around .
`` i 'm going to be a good father and a good husband . ''

documents.title: birmingham trust says it could have taken over worcestershire hospital
text: the trust running birmingham 's hospitals has suggested it could have stepped in to keep some emergency services at the alexandra in redditch if it had been allowed to take over the hospital .

hereford & worcester has seen a letter from university hospitals birmingham which criticises plans to move some services out of redditch , saying changes there have already led to a 17 % increase in patients travelling to birmingham for emergency treatment .
nhs managers want to permanently move some a & e , maternity and childrens ' services from redditch to worcester - in the face of fierce opposition from a campaign group .
the letter from the trust running hospitals in birmingham suggests there was another option - to allow it to take over redditch and possibly keep some services there .
but letting a birmingham trust take over the alexandra hospital would probably create big financial problems for the rest of worcestershire .
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: calls for m6 to be taken into public ownership
text: the question of a free m6 toll has been resurrected - this time in a city a little further north .

labour 's candidate for the west midlands metro mayor , mep sion simon , has told delegates at the party 's conference in liverpool that he ca n't see why it should n't be taken into public ownership for the benefit of the region .

of course we know the possibility of making the road free was being discussed in the very early days of a devolution deal for the west midlands , a move that unsurprisingly did n't make the final george osborne cut .
but many have spoken about a possibly £ 2bn benefit to the local economy if the congestion through the m6 bottleneck could be eased .
and now a certain toll road happens to be up for sale .
it looks like the subject could be back on the table as we head towards a metro mayoral election next may .
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: council to step up rat-catching after reports of 'infestation '
text: residents in a black country town say they 're dealing with a rat infestation after the council failed to take action for nine months .
the problem was reported after a nest was found at brandhall golf club in oldbury in january .
now sandwell council say it will step up baits in the area
author: Ben Godfrey
BBC Midlands Today

text: weather watcher elle niño sent in this great from solihull .
you can just see the first hints of autumn in the trees .

documents.title: investigation launched into jlr crash death
text: police say they 'll be working with the health and safety executive to investigate the death of a 23-year-old motorcyclist at the jaguar land rover factory site in solihull .
the 23-year-old died after a collision with a manufacturing tractor unit and trailer on a private road , inside the factory site .

documents.title: birmingham airport invests £ 100m on infrastructure
text: birmingham airport says it 's investing £ 100m on improvements including hold-baggage screening , self-service check-in and additional car parking .
a new drop-off car park - free for 30 minutes - .
is planned along with upgrades to existing parking .
the `` ambitious '' plan is to double the number of self-service bag drop kiosks and improve the digital check-in process .

text: chanda chauhan said the hse 's investigation into the smiler crash is `` one step to closure '' but she 's `` still struggling '' .

documents.title: football : grayson unconcerned by preston league position
text: the preston manager , simon grayson , says he is not paying too much attention to their current league placing .
friday 's 1-0 win over wigan moved north end three points clear of the championship relegation zone .
preston face birmingham at st andrews this evening .
you can hear commentary on the game from 19:45 , on bbc radio lancashire .

documents.title: dog microchips : outdated contact details leave animals unclaimed
text: nearly 1,000 stray dogs in the midlands could not be reunited with their owners last year due to outdated microchips , animal charity dogs trust has said .
the charity found 6,667 dogs were left unclaimed in local authority kennels between april 2015 and march 2016 .
one in eight were pets that could not be returned as their microchips had not been updated by their owners , it said .
in april , it became a legal requirement for all pet dogs to be microchipped with current contact details .

documents.title: smiler crash victim : 'do not be fooled , we struggle every day '
text: chanda chauhan and her daughter vanisha singh were sat on the second row of the smiler ride when it crashed into the carriage infront on 2 june 2015 .
ms chauhan needed surgery to her stomach and has received further treatment for a damaged liver and blood clots .
she was at stafford crown court today where alton towers ' operator merlin was fined £ 5m over the crash .
speaking of merlin 's fine to the press association , chanda said : `` i did think it was going to be more but as i said before it is still irrelevant to what situation we 're still in .
five million does n't mean anything to me . ''

talking of how her life has changed , she said , `` i 'm scared to go in a car even now but i do it because i have to , i 'm a mother and i want to be independent and it 's taken me nearly a year just to be out here like this . ''
`` i used to be a confident person , i ca n't just go out like i want to . ''
`` psychologically , psychiatric effects on people are invisible but they are there , do not be fooled .
we struggle every day with it . ''

documents.title: scam warning over mrs brown 's boys show
text: scam warning over mrs brown 's boys show

documents.title: hse : 'people expect to enjoy themselves at a theme park '
text: neil craig , hse 's head of operations for the midlands has given a brief statement about the alton towers court case .
he said : `` when people visit theme parks they should be able to enjoy themselves safely .
`` merlin failed to protect their customers .
they let them badly down .
it is right they have been held to account for those failings in a criminal court .
`` this avoidable incident happened because merlin failed to put in place systems that would allow their engineers to work safely while the ride was running . ''
chanda chauhan from wednesbury was among 16 people hurt in last june 's crash .

documents.title: west midlands rovers vs manchester united ?
text: how would you like to see a 'west midlands rovers ' football team competing with the likes of manchester united and liverpool ?
that 's the idea coming from siôn simon , the labour party candidate hoping to become the first west midlands 'metro ' mayor .
the former minister said birmingham 's international reputation has been damaged by the lack of a leading football club .
he said it is unfortunate there is not a `` west midlands rovers '' or a `` super premium global football brand '' that could attract fans in china .

documents.title: motorists prosecuted for driving too close to cyclists
text: fourteen motorists will receive prosecution notices for driving too close to cyclists .
the central motorway police group tweets the drivers were given the notices this week .
motorists who drive too close to cyclists as they overtake are being targeted by west midlands police officers on bikes .
cyclists should be given at least the same space as vehicles , widely considered to be 1.5m ( 4.9ft ) , and offending drivers risk prosecution .

documents.title: 'money will never replace limbs '
text: paul paxton from stewarts law , who is acting on behalf of eight alton towers victims , has given his statement outside of stafford crown court .
he said : `` symbolically and practically , today marks a closure of what has been a long and painful chapter for my clients , one of which they have been exposed to the horrors of that day .
`` the court has imposed what we believe is a record fine for the industry , but of course money alone will never replace limbs nor heal the psychological scars .
`` it 's worth remembering this hearing is the first time that my clients have heard the full extent of the criticisms against merlin .
`` they have been shocked and disappointed by the catalogue of errors . ''

documents.title: birmingham street preacher guilty of abusing woman over 'tight jeans '
text: a street preacher who told a muslim woman in birmingham that she 'd 'burn in hell ' for wearing tight jeans , is due to be sentenced later .
krisonni henderson , 31 , of brook street , birmingham , was arrested in july .
he also told the passer-by in new street that she was a non-believer and a prostitute .
he was found guilty yesterday of religiously aggravated threatening behaviour .

text: london midland
londonmidland
due to trespassers on the line , services running through lichfield city station may be delayed

documents.title: motorcyclist dies after crash at jlr site
text: a man has died after he was involved in a crash at the the jaguar land rover ( jlr ) plant in solihull .
a statement from jlr says the man was an employee of one of their suppliers , and are working `` closely with the authorities '' to look at how the crash , on monday afternoon , occurred .
the motorcyclist somehow collided with a hgv at the plant .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: alton towers operator merlin fined £ 5m over smiler crash
text: victims and families of the crash on the smiler rollercoaster are in court for today 's sentencing of merlin entertainment .
the alton towers operator has been fined £ 5m after admitting health and safety breaches over the crash .
chanda chauhan from wednesbury was among sixteen people injured in the crash last june , including two teenage girls who needed leg amputations .
ms chauhan , 51 , had surgery to her stomach and further treatment for a damaged liver .

documents.title: football : blues without a home win against preston in over 40 years
text: birmingham city manager gary rowett is n't underestimating this evening 's visitors , preston , despite their indifferent start to the season .
the blues lie in 6th but are without a clean sheet in their last 10 home league games against preston , last keeping one in march 1970 .
rowett knows preston are working to a similarly tight budget .

they 've had to , like us , lose a few of their better players along the way just because of the nature of where their club is at as we all know when players perform well in the championship the vultures start circling and try to off the best bits , but i think they 've done an impressive job .
author: BBC WM Sport

text: alton towers has been fined £ 5m for the smiler crash of june 2015 .

documents.title: jeetan patel : warwickshire spinner wins most valuable player award for second time
text: warwickshire off-spinner jeetan patel has won the professional cricketers ' association ( pca ) most valuable player award for a second time .
patel , 36 , took 102 wickets in all formats for the bears in 2016 , which included 69 in the county championship .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: relatives waiting for legal aid at 'crunch time '
text: the families of the birmingham pub bombings victims say they want to know whether or not they 've been granted legal aid for the new inquests before the conservatives arrive in the city for their conference at the weekend .
the legal aid agency is still to decide on their application , although the home secretary has said she does support them .
julie hambleton 's sister maxine was killed in the blasts in 1974 .
she told bbc wm it 's crucial they get a decision soon so their legal team can start preparing properly .

we 're at such a crunch time now , we need all the support from everywhere , our community , birmingham councillors , even the lord mayor is right behind us , we need all the help to put pressure on so the legal aid agency can come through for us .

text: the chief executives of gatwick and birmingham airports have written to the prime minister in a bid to block expansion at heathrow .

BBC Live reporter

documents.title: football : wolves winger used to busy fixture list
text: wolves head to wigan this evening with the wanderers having kept just one clean sheet in their past 12 away league games .
it 's been another busy run of fixtures , which could be a challenge to some of the club 's new overseas players .
winger ivan cavaleiro 's not at all fazed by the fixture list .
when i was 19 i played for benfica and we played saturday for the championship , wednesday or tuesday for champions league so it 's not a new thing more .
author: BBC WM Sport

documents.title: football : 'we can only get better and better ' says villa keeper
text: aston villa goalkeeper pierluigi gollini insists the fans ' patience will be rewarded with victories soon .
villa head to barnsley in the championship tonight , still looking for a second victory of the season , and gollini insists they 're starting to gel .

we are a new team , a lot of new players , we can train together , but when you play on a saturday it 's always different the more we play , the more we know each other and we can only get better and better .
author: BBC WM Sport

documents.title: speed cameras catch almost 8,000 motorists
text: average speed cameras in birmingham and solihull have recorded almost 8,000 speeding drivers in the six weeks since they were switched on .
police say 7,950 offences have been passed on to the camera enforcement team for potential prosecution .
cameras at eight sites including the a38 bristol road in edgbaston , the a45 coventry road and the a3400 in hockley heath were activated on 8 august .

documents.title: 'tight jeans ' tirade : street preacher guilty of threatening behaviour
text: a street preacher who told a muslim woman she would `` burn in hell '' for wearing tight jeans has been found guilty of religiously aggravated threatening behaviour .

birmingham magistrates ' court was told krissoni henderson also called his victim - a passer-by in new street , birmingham - a non-believer and a prostitute before branding police `` disgusting '' atheists .
he shouted `` allahu akbar '' before he was arrested .
henderson , of brook street in the city 's jewellery quarter , was not preaching at the time of the tirade , the court heard .
he is due to be sentenced tomorrow .
the 31-year-old - who quoted from both the koran and the bible after emerging from court - declined to confirm his religion at the hearing , telling magistrates : `` my religion is humanity .
my religion is to love people regardless of what they wear . ''

documents.title: man injured in hit-and-run crash dies
text: a man who was injured in a hit-and-run collision in birmingham at the weekend has died .
he was taken to hospital after he was hit by a car on lawley middleway in the early hours of yesterday morning .
police have been unable to identify the victim and are appealing for anyone who may know who is to come forward .
a 78-year-old man was arrested yesterday on sus of drink-driving and failing to stop at the scene of a collision .
he was bailed as enquiries continue .

documents.title: pub bombings : law firm says `` no reasons given '' over legal funding refusal
text: human rights lawyers krw law llp have told the bbc `` there were no reasons given '' as to why legal funding for the birmingham pub bombings relatives was turned down ahead of next year 's inquests .
relatives from the justice for the 21 campaign group met with home secretary amber rudd last month to appeal for public funds .

in a telephone call to julie hambleton , the sister of victim maxine hambleton , and in a letter to her and krw law llp , the home secretary expressed both her sympathy and support , but had decided not to offer funding .
author: Chris Blakemore
BBC WM

documents.title: man jailed for rape after ten-year man hunt
text: a man who attacked and repeatedly raped a woman has today been sentenced to 13-and-a-half years in prison after evading police for more than a decade , police say .
rashid abdilah jama , 39 , was originally arrested in 2005 by officers investigating a gang rape attack on a woman at a house in alum rock .
he fled while on bail , eventually ending up in sweden before being extradited to england in 2015 to face charges .
he pleaded guilty to rape at birmingham crown court and was ordered to sign the sex offenders register for life .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: acid spill : five receive hospital treatment
text: five people have been taken to hospital following this afternoon 's 1,000-litre acid spill near wolverhampton .
the hydrochloric acid spilled from a bulk container transported by lorry on anchor lane in coseley .
west midlands fire service - which has sent 70 firefighters to the scene - has warned neighbouring residents to shut windows and doors .
the region 's ambulance service says the five were taken to hospital as a precautionary measure .

documents.title: hazardous acid spill - 1,000 litres hit street
text: one thousand litres of hydrochloric acid have spilled from a bulk container transported by lorry on anchor lane in coseley , wolverhampton .
west midlands fire service has said six engines and 70 firefighters are at the scene and the incident is `` ongoing '' .
nearby residents have been advised to keep their windows and doors closed - standard procedure when hazardous chemical are involved .
the city of wolverhampton council has said the nearby tip on anchor lane is closed while crews deal with the spill .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: public funding ruled out for pub bombings lawyers
text: families of the birmingham pub bombings victims want confirmation `` by the end of the week '' of whether they will receive legal aid .
it comes after the government refused a request from victims ' relatives to pay their legal fees .

inquests into the deaths of 21 people are due to be held next year and the families had hoped to secure an arrangement mirroring the hillsborough inquests , where costs incurred were met by the government .
home secretary amber rudd told families their request had been refused , but legal aid may still be granted .

our bit of the work is done we 've got to come back as it 's only a temporary repair to the carriageway , so we will be back but clearly we wo n't be doing that work in rush hour . ''

the penkridge-born stopper has had limited opportunities since rejoining the club from leyton orient in 2015 but is getting a chance with thomas kuszcazck out injured .

documents.title: school will not stick to its 'guns ' over name change
text: a school called guns village for the last 100 years is to change its name over people 's `` disbelief '' at the title .
headteacher dawn cooper said the title had `` caused us problems over the years '' , including the frequent misspelling `` gunns '' as correspondents battled with the `` surprise '' name .
staff at the west bromwich school were also hindered , she said , when using it systems as use of the word `` guns '' would block them .
the name reflects the links of the school 's former site to the gun manufacturing trade but following a consultation exercise , it will be known as hanbury primary from september 2017 .

many visitors to the school from outside the area have expressed surprise at the school 's name and frequently it is misspelt as 'gunns ' in correspondence due to the disbelief that a school carries the name 'guns ' within its title .

documents.title: birmingham conman under surveillance for 16 years
text: the bbc has learned that a notorious conman , who was shot dead last year , had been under surveillance by secret intelligence officers for at least 16 years .
john `` goldfinger '' palmer , from olton , solihull , was shot dead in the garden of his home in essex in june 2015 .
an operation , code-named 'alpine ' , had gathered intelligence on the former scrap metal dealer - once described as britain 's richest criminal - from an raf base in cumbria since 1999 .
police said palmer 's killing had `` all the hallmarks '' of a professional hit .
author: BBC News England
